title: Banana Bread
imageAlt: Moist vegan banana bread with walnuts
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (top/bottom heat).
2. Thoroughly mash the bananas with the oil, plant milk, and vanilla sugar in a bowl, but do not completely puree.
3. Add the dry ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cornstarch) and mix everything well.
4. Pour the batter into a greased baking pan and bake for about 60 minutes. Use a toothpick test to check if the bread is fully baked.

title: Lentil Bolognese
imageAlt: Hearty vegan lentil bolognese with pasta
instructions: 1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente.
2. Meanwhile, dice the onion and sauté with minced garlic and turmeric in a pan with some oil until translucent.
3. Chop vegetables and mushrooms, add to the pan with spices, and sauté for 5-10 minutes until roasted.
4. Add lentils, chopped tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, vegetable broth, and nutritional yeast. Stir well, bring to a boil, and simmer over medium heat for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Serve the sauce over the pasta and garnish with extra nutritional yeast or fresh herbs.

title: Vegetable Paella
imageAlt: Colorful vegan paella in a pan
instructions: 1. Fry the tofu topping in a little oil until golden brown, then remove from the pan and set aside.
2. Dice onions, garlic, and bell pepper. Sauté them in the same pan with oil until soft and translucent.
3. Add the rice and spices (paprika, turmeric), stir well, and fry for a few minutes.
4. Pour in the vegetable broth and stir once to distribute everything evenly.
5. From this point on, avoid stirring. Bring to a boil and cook for about 10 minutes.
6. Reduce heat. Distribute cherry tomatoes, the fried topping, and peas on top and press them lightly into the rice. Partially cover and simmer for another 10 minutes.
7. Once the liquid is absorbed, check if a crust (socarrat) has formed at the bottom using a spoon.
8. Remove from heat, let it rest briefly, and serve garnished with parsley and lemon wedges.

title: Creamy Lentil Skillet
imageAlt: Creamy red lentil skillet served in a pan
instructions: 1. Rinse the lentils briefly. (If using brown lentils, soak them beforehand; not necessary for red lentils).
2. Dice the onions, garlic, and bell pepper. Sauté in a pan with a little oil, salt, pepper, and chili for 3-5 minutes.
3. Add oregano, soy sauce, and vinegar, and continue to sauté briefly.
4. Add lentils and vegetable broth. Let simmer until the liquid is mostly absorbed (approx. 15-20 minutes).
5. Mix vegan cream and cornstarch smoothly in a small bowl, add to the pan, and bring to a brief boil until the sauce thickens.
6. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with a side of your choice (e.g., potatoes).

title: White Bean & Apple Skillet
imageAlt: White beans and apple pieces with smoked tofu in a bowl
ingredients: Fresh herbs and seeds for topping
instructions: 1. Cut the smoked tofu, onion, and apples into small, bite-sized pieces.
2. Sauté the onion and smoked tofu in a pan with a little oil until lightly browned.
3. Add the vegetable broth, soy sauce, apple pieces, cashew butter, and white beans to the pan. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Heat everything thoroughly gently stirring until the sauce is creamy.
5. Serve immediately, garnished with herbs and seeds.

title: Crispy Tarte Flambée
imageAlt: Crispy tarte flambée with red onions and smoked tofu
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven (according to package instructions for the dough, usually about 220°C).
2. Mix Creme Vega with soy yogurt and season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
3. Cut the onion into thin half-rings. Cut the smoked tofu and bell pepper into small cubes or strips.
4. Roll out the dough and spread with the cream. Top with onions, bell pepper, and smoked tofu. Optionally drizzle with a little oil.
5. Bake in the oven for about 10-15 minutes until golden brown.
6. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving.

title: Chili Sin Carne
imageAlt: Bowl of red chili sin carne with rice and parsley
ingredients: 125g dry soy granules (or 250g ready vegan mince)
Salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder
instructions: 1. If using dry soy granules, prepare them according to package instructions (soak/boil). Prepare the rice or bulgur separately.
2. Sauté the soy granules (or mince) with diced onions, garlic, turmeric, and oil at high heat to create roasted flavors.
3. Stir in the tomato paste and paprika spices, roasting briefly.
4. Deglaze with a small amount of vegetable broth to loosen bits from the bottom of the pan.
5. Add the kidney beans, corn, chopped tomatoes, sugar, nutritional yeast, remaining broth, and cumin.
6. Stir well, bring to a boil, and let simmer on low heat until the desired consistency is reached (approx. 20 mins). Season to taste.
7. Serve with the cooked rice/bulgur and garnish with parsley.

title: Creamy Vegetable Pasta
imageAlt: Penne pasta with broccoli in creamy sauce
instructions: 1. Cut broccoli into small florets and wash. Cook pasta according to package instructions.
2. Toast pine nuts in a pan without oil until golden brown and set aside.
3. Add broccoli with about 100ml salted water to the pan, bring to a boil, and steam covered for 4 minutes.
4. Add chopped garlic, halved tomatoes, and Italian herbs. Continue steaming until broccoli is tender-crisp and water has evaporated.
5. Stir in maple syrup, vegan cream, and lime juice, and simmer briefly until the sauce is creamy.
6. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh basil. Mix with pasta and top with pine nuts.

title: Onion Tartare (Rice Cake Style)
imageAlt: Vegan onion tartare on a bread roll
instructions: 1. Crumble the rice cakes into a bowl. Add the water and let soak briefly until the cakes are soft.
2. Mash the soaked cakes with a fork into an even consistency.
3. Stir in tomato paste and finely diced onions. Season generously with salt and pepper.
4. For the best flavor, let the vegan tartare rest in the refrigerator for a few hours or overnight. Serve on fresh bread or rolls.

title: One-Pot Vegetable Orzotto
imageAlt: Tomato based orzo dish with peppers and tofu
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C. Roughly chop peppers, onion, and fresh tomatoes. Toss with oil, salt, and pepper in a baking dish and roast for 25 minutes until soft.
2. Meanwhile, dice the smoked tofu (or mushrooms). Sauté in a large pot or deep pan with oil, garlic, and turmeric until browned.
3. Add the passata, water, and uncooked orzo to the pot. Let simmer uncovered until the liquid absorbs and pasta is cooked (stir frequently to prevent sticking).
4. Once the pasta is ready, stir in the roasted vegetables from the oven, soy sauce, and remaining spices.
5. Season to taste and serve garnished with fresh chopped herbs.

title: Tortilla Chili Casserole
imageAlt: Casserole dish filled with rice, beans, and topped with tortilla chips
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 180°C (convection).
2. Sauté the diced onion and vegan mince in a pan with oil until browned. Transfer to a large mixing bowl.
3. Dice the bell pepper and zucchini, sauté briefly in the same pan, and add to the bowl.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes, corn, kidney beans, and salsa to the bowl. Mix everything thoroughly.
5. Spread the cooked rice at the bottom of a greased casserole dish. Pour the vegetable-mince mixture over the rice.
6. Top with vegan cheese and a layer of tortilla chips.
7. Bake for 20 minutes until the cheese melts and chips are crispy.

title: Broccoli & Chickpea Stir-Fry
imageAlt: Glossy stir-fry with broccoli and chickpeas over rice
ingredients: Sauce: 120ml water, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1.5 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tbsp maple syrup, 1 tbsp cornstarch
instructions: 1. Whisk together the sauce ingredients (water, soy sauce, vinegar, syrup, cornstarch) in a small bowl and set aside.
2. Finely chop onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté in a pan with the dry spices and a little oil over medium heat until fragrant.
3. Cut broccoli into florets. Add to the pan along with the vegetable broth. Cover and steam/fry for about 10 minutes until broccoli is tender-crisp.
4. Give the sauce a quick whisk and pour it into the pan. Add the drained chickpeas.
5. Increase heat slightly and stir constantly until the sauce bubbles and thickens (approx. 2-3 minutes).
6. Serve hot over cooked rice.
